pages.title: ‚öîÔ∏è Battles Overview
pages.description:
Veyra battles are a **turn-based mind game**. Every round, both players choose an action (called a **stance**) and the system resolves the outcome based on speed, prediction, and your loadout.

There are two ways to battle:
‚Ä¢ **PvP**: challenge another player for gold
‚Ä¢ **Campaign (PvE)**: fight Veyra herself for progression using `/campaign`

This guide teaches everything you need to win.

fields.name: Main Commands
fields.value:
‚Ä¢ `/battle @user <bet>` - Challenge a player (PvP)
‚Ä¢ `/campaign` - Solo campaign battles (PvE)
‚Ä¢ `/loadout <weapon> <spell>` - Set your gear

More info:
‚Ä¢ `!details campaign`
‚Ä¢ `!details loadout`

fields.name: Core Idea
fields.value:
Battles aren‚Äôt about spamming attack. They‚Äôre about:
‚úÖ predicting opponent stance
‚úÖ managing HP + Mana
‚úÖ timing Block/Counter
‚úÖ using your spell at the right moment

pages.title: üìä Core Stats (What matters)
pages.description:
Every fighter has a stat sheet. Your **weapon modifies** these values.

Base stats (before weapon bonuses):
‚Ä¢ **HP**: 40
‚Ä¢ **Attack**: 5
‚Ä¢ **Defense**: 0
‚Ä¢ **Speed**: 10
‚Ä¢ **Mana**: 10

Extra mechanic:
‚Ä¢ **Frost**: starts at 0 and builds up from certain weapons/spells.

fields.name: HP
fields.value:
Your health. **0 HP = defeat.**
Some effects block healing, so don‚Äôt rely on Recover/Heal forever.

fields.name: Speed
fields.value:
Speed affects:
‚Ä¢ who goes first
‚Ä¢ how reliable Block is
‚Ä¢ some penalties/rewards during stance clashes

fields.name: Mana
fields.value:
Used for casting spells.
Run out of mana = you can‚Äôt Cast, and some matchups become unwinnable.

pages.title: üßç Stances (Your 5 actions)
pages.description:
Every round you choose exactly **one** stance. Each stance is strong into some stances and weak into others.

Mastering the stance mindgame is what separates winners from‚Ä¶ spectators.

fields.name: ‚öîÔ∏è Attack
fields.value:
Deal damage based on your Attack stat.
‚ùå Can get blocked/countered.

fields.name: üõ°Ô∏è Block
fields.value:
Reduce incoming damage by **70%**.
‚úÖ On success, you gain defense.
‚ùå Can fail if you‚Äôre too slow (Speed matters).
‚ö†Ô∏è If both players Block, both lose **7 HP**.

fields.name: üîÅ Counter
fields.value:
Predictive stance. If opponent Attacks, reflect **50%** of their damage back.
‚úÖ Destroys aggressive players.
‚ùå If opponent doesn‚Äôt Attack, you get punished (speed/defense penalties).

fields.name: üíß Recover
fields.value:
Regenerate **HP or Mana** (alternates).
‚úÖ Best used when opponent is defensive.
‚ùå Can be interrupted by Attack.

fields.name: üîÆ Cast
fields.value:
Use your equipped spell (costs Mana).
‚úÖ Spells can swing fights instantly.
‚ö†Ô∏è Faster caster wins when both cast.

pages.title: üß† Stance Matchups (How rounds resolve)
pages.description:
Here‚Äôs the simplified matchup logic (most important interactions).

**Attack vs Attack:** both deal damage (faster goes first)
**Attack vs Recover:** recover gets interrupted
**Attack vs Block:** block reduces damage
**Attack vs Counter:** counter reflects damage

**Block vs Block:** both lose 7 HP
**Counter vs Counter:** both lose 10 defense

**Cast** beats all actions.

If you want a rule of thumb:
‚Ä¢ Attack beats Recover
‚Ä¢ Block beats Attack
‚Ä¢ Counter beats Attack
‚Ä¢ Cast beats all (if you can pay mana)

fields.name: Speed Priority
fields.value: When outcomes depend on timing (Attack order / Cast vs Cast / block defensive checks), **higher Speed wins**.

fields.name: Punishment Examples
fields.value:
Some wrong guesses cause penalties. Examples:
‚Ä¢ Block vs Counter: speed penalties
‚Ä¢ Counter vs Block: speed penalties
‚Ä¢ Recover vs Counter: penalty to the wrong counter

Moral: guessing wrong hurts.

pages.title: üåë Status Effects (And how to play around them)
pages.description: Status effects are timed or stacking mechanics that persist across rounds. They‚Äôre usually applied by **spells** or certain **weapons**.

fields.name: Nightfall (5 rounds)
fields.value:
Each round: **a random stat is reduced by 2**.
This can ruin Speed-based plans, so don‚Äôt get greedy.

fields.name: Large Heal (4 rounds)
fields.value:
Each round: **heal 4 HP**.
Strong sustain tool, especially if you can force opponent defensive.

fields.name: Frostbite (stacking)
fields.value:
Builds Frost stacks. At **10 stacks**, target takes **50% of their current HP** as damage.
This is why Frost builds are terrifying.

fields.name: Veil of Darkness (4 rounds)
fields.value:
Incoming **Attack damage reduced by 60%**.
This punishes pure Attack spammers hard.

pages.title: ‚è±Ô∏è Turn Timer + Penalties
pages.description: Nyx battles don‚Äôt wait forever. Each player must pick a stance within the timer.

fields.name: Round Timer
fields.value: You have **50 seconds** to choose your action each round.

fields.name: Timeout Penalty
fields.value:
If you fail to choose in time:
‚Ä¢ you take **-25 HP**
‚Ä¢ your action defaults to **Attack**

So yes, you can lose because you went AFK.

fields.name: Winning Tip
fields.value:
If your opponent is low and slow, pressuring them makes timeouts more likely.
(They‚Äôll call it "unfair". It isn‚Äôt.)

pages.title: ü§∫ PvP Battles (How betting works)
pages.description:
PvP is a 1v1 battle with gold on the line.

Flow:
1) Challenger uses `/battle @opponent <bet>`
2) Bet is deducted instantly
3) Opponent accepts/declines
4) If accepted, opponent bet is deducted
5) Battle begins
6) Winner earns the pot minus fee

fields.name: Payout
fields.value:
Winner gets **90%** of the total pot.
Veyra takes **10%** fee.

fields.name: Etiquette (optional)
fields.value:
Bet what you can afford.
If you lose, don‚Äôt cry in chat like it‚Äôs a war crime.

pages.title: üß∞ Loadouts (Weapons + Spells)
pages.description:
Your loadout matters a lot. A good loadout makes your strategy easier; a bad loadout makes it painful.

Set your loadout with:
`/loadout <weapon> <spell>`

For the FULL gear breakdown, use:
`!details loadout`

pages.title: üèÜ How to Actually Win
pages.description: If you want to be dangerous (and not just noisy), follow these principles:

fields.name: 1) Stop spamming Attack
fields.value: Good players punish patterns. Mix in Block/Counter/Cast to stay unpredictable.

fields.name: 2) Track their mana
fields.value: If they‚Äôre low mana, their strongest option (Cast) disappears. That‚Äôs when you pressure.

fields.name: 3) Use Recover like a chess move
fields.value: Recover isn‚Äôt a panic button. Use it when you expect defense or when you‚Äôve forced their hand.

fields.name: 4) Build toward a win condition
fields.value:
Examples:
‚Ä¢ Frost stacks ‚Üí burst at 10
‚Ä¢ Nightfall ‚Üí stat collapse
‚Ä¢ Heavyshot timing ‚Üí swing HP state

Random moves lose to real plans.
